intro: Arnebia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow orkney carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pink to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Arnebia flavescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
